list_definition.definition: (with to) to promise to receive and pay for a series of issues of (a magazine etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I’ve been subscribing to that magazine for four years.

list_definition.definition: to give money, with other people, to a charity or other cause

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He subscribes to a lot of charities
We each subscribed $1 towards the present.

list_ex_of_english: Would you consider subscribing to both seasons?
What action has been taken in the past year by the international consortium to which this country subscribes?
However, we hesitate in subscribing to this line of reasoning.
Then we have the concept of a permanent international court which is subscribed to by over 100 countries.
All this money has to be found, in addition to the money subscribed for shares, whether by premium or not.
Money has been subscribed for this hospital which consists of only 24 beds and one operating theatre.
In their efforts to improve the sensory experiences of the poor, missionary aesthetes subscribed to a liberatory aesthetic rather than a decadent one.
They all subscribed to these values, although to varying degrees.
